entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 17 at 12:13PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy rainfall could increase flows on rivers and streams this weekend... An increase of deep moisture will have the potential to produce heavy rainfall over portions of Southwestern Colorado and Eastern Utah. The rainfall can lead to quick increases in flows on rivers, stream and creeks. Most of the larger rivers and streams have the

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 4:37AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...INCREASED FIRE DANGER IN EFFECT FROM NOON EDT TODAY THROUGH THIS EVENING... Relative humidity values of 25 percent or lower will develop for several hours this afternoon and evening. With dry fuels and temperatures in the mid 80s, elevated fire danger is expected despite fairly light winds.

entry.cap:areaDesc: Grand; San Juan

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 18 at 3:39PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: Very warm temperatures will continue through the weekend. These temperatures, combined with windy conditions, will result in significant high-mountain snowmelt once again. It is likely most small streams and creeks, and possibly some main stem rivers, will likely reach high levels again. Currently only bankfull conditions (Action Stage) to minor low-land flooding (Minor Stage Flooding) is
entry.cap:areaDesc: Big Horn; Fremont; Hot Springs; Johnson; Park; Teton; Washakie

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 18 at 3:30PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Warm temperatures since Thursday have caused higher elevation snow melt to occurred again. Water levels in the Medicine Lodge Creek have risen since last night, as a result. This trend is expected to continue tonight into Sunday. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Big Horn
